newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Pacific Can sees construction profits down.
newsitem.headline: Pacific Can sees construction profits down.

text.p: Pacific Can Investment Holdings Ltd said on Tuesday it expected profits from its construction division to fall further.

"Although sales of ready-mix concrete is expected to increase, the profit of this division is expected to decline because of lower margins and higher depreciation charges," Pacific Can said in a note with its first-half financial results.
Construction revenues grew 27.8 percent year on year to Singapore $20.9 million in the six months to March 31, 1997 against S$16.3 million previously.
The division's pre-tax loss in the period narrowed to S$1.1 million against S$2.3 million previously.

The outlook was similarly pessimistic for can operations the note added, with a joint venture operation in Malaysia not expected to contribute positively in the current business year and the outlook for can making in China remaining poor.
"The group does not expect positive contributions from its joint venture in Malaysia in the current financial year," it said, attributing the weakness to start up costs and low market penetration.
Pacific Can earlier reported an interim net loss of S$5.7 million, a slight improvement on the previous period's S$6.9 million deficit.
It said lower revenues and provisions for anticipated losses on certain contracts and doubtful debts were responsible for the interim loss.
